poem:
### One Flag Policy

Above a distant consulate,  
the Stars and Stripes unfurl alone,  
once companions to bursts of color—  
rainbow banners, whispered histories—  
now folded, unseen.  
The wind is told to homogenize its song,  
a single note echoing down marble halls,  
while voices murmur underneath,  
their hues tucked away, waiting.
